question.content: Who was the first Indian to receive the International Federation (ISSF) Blue Cross?

solution.content: Abhinav Bindra. On 30 November 2018, Bindra became the first Indian to receive the prestigious Blue Cross, the ISSF's highest honour.

question.content: The major component of modern Olympic gold medals is

solution.content: Silver. Olympic Gold medals are required to be made from pure silver, and must contain a minimum of 6 grams of gold. All olympics medals must be at least 60 mm in diameter and 3 mm thick. It is the responsibility of the Olympic host to mint the medal proper.

question.content: To which of the following Indian states does Mardani Khel, one of the famous martial art forms in India belong?

solution.content: Maharashtra. It is particularly known for its use of the uniquely Indian patta (sword) and vita (corded lance).
